technicalView.problem: Your data is fragmented across on-premise data warehouses, cloud storage, SaaS applications, and legacy databases. Insights take days or weeks to generate due to manual ETL processes, data quality issues cause 30%+ rework, and governance gaps create compliance risks. Current architecture cannot scale to handle real-time analytics requirements or support AI/ML workloads effectively.
technicalView.solution: We implement a modern lakehouse architecture using Microsoft Fabric as the unified data platform, with OneLake providing single-copy storage across all compute engines. Azure Databricks handles complex transformations and ML workloads using Delta Lake for ACID transactions. Purview automates data cataloging, lineage tracking, and policy enforcement. Real-time pipelines built on Event Hubs and Stream Analytics enable sub-second insights. Power BI provides self-service analytics with AI-powered insights.
technicalView.approach: Phase 1 (Weeks 1-3): Data landscape assessment, architecture design, pilot use case selection. Phase 2 (Weeks 4-8): Foundation setup - OneLake configuration, security baselines, initial data ingestion from 2-3 critical sources. Phase 3 (Weeks 9-12): Production deployment - complete ETL automation, governance policies, Power BI dashboards, MLOps framework. Ongoing: Knowledge transfer, optimization, scaling to additional data sources.

leadershipView.problem: Your executive team makes decisions based on data that's 3-7 days old, creating competitive disadvantage in fast-moving markets. Data quality issues cost approximately ‚Çπ8-12 Cr annually in operational inefficiencies and rework. Compliance teams struggle with data lineage and audit requirements, risking regulatory penalties. Current data infrastructure costs are growing 25-30% annually while business value delivery remains flat.
leadershipView.solution: We deliver real-time decision intelligence that reduces insight latency from days to hours (or minutes for critical metrics), enabling faster market response. Automated data quality and governance reduce operational costs by 40% while ensuring regulatory compliance. Modern cloud-native architecture delivers 50% lower total cost of ownership compared to legacy systems. Self-service analytics democratizes data access, enabling 5x more business users to make data-driven decisions without IT bottlenecks.
leadershipView.approach: 6-week rapid start delivers first business value: automated dashboards for top 3 KPIs, real-time alerting for critical metrics, and governance framework. Initial investment: ‚Çπ2.5-3.5 Cr for foundation. ROI realized within 8-10 months through reduced data engineering costs, faster decision cycles, and improved operational efficiency. Proven delivery model used with 40+ Fortune 500 clients including 3 companies in your industry vertical.

technicalView.problem: Your organization has 3-8 AI/ML pilots in experimental phase but none have reached production at scale. Models are built in notebooks without proper versioning, deployment requires 4-6 weeks of manual DevOps work, and model performance degrades over time without monitoring. No standardized MLOps process exists, creating inconsistent quality and security risks. Integration with existing applications requires significant custom development effort.
technicalView.solution: We establish end-to-end MLOps infrastructure using Azure Machine Learning with automated pipelines for training, validation, and deployment. Azure OpenAI provides enterprise-grade generative AI capabilities with responsible AI guardrails. Models are containerized and deployed to AKS or Azure ML managed endpoints with automatic scaling. Azure Monitor tracks model performance, data drift, and business KPIs with automated alerts. Integration patterns enable seamless connection to existing applications via REST APIs, SDK libraries, or event-driven architectures.
technicalView.approach: Phase 1 (Weeks 1-2): ML landscape assessment, use case prioritization (ROI √ó feasibility matrix), architecture design. Phase 2 (Weeks 3-6): MLOps foundation - Azure ML workspace, CI/CD pipelines, model registry, monitoring framework. Phase 3 (Weeks 7-12): First production use case - data preparation, model training/tuning, integration, deployment. Parallel: Responsible AI framework implementation, team training on MLOps practices, documentation.

leadershipView.problem: Your competitors are deploying AI features in production while your pilots remain stuck in experimentation, creating market share risk. Current AI initiatives show unclear ROI with pilots costing ‚Çπ50-80 Lakh each but delivering no business value. Data science team spends 70% time on infrastructure rather than model development. Concerns about AI ethics, bias, and regulatory compliance slow adoption further.

Business value typical examples: Customer service chatbot saves ‚Çπ4-6 Cr annually, fraud detection prevents ‚Çπ10-15 Cr in losses, predictive maintenance reduces downtime by 25-30%.

technicalView.problem: Your monolithic applications take 6-12 months to add new features due to complex dependencies and manual deployment processes. Development teams wait days for infrastructure provisioning. Testing is primarily manual, requiring 2-3 week regression cycles before each release. Multiple technology stacks create maintenance burden. No standardized observability makes troubleshooting production issues time-consuming. Security and compliance checks happen at the end, causing delays and rework.
technicalView.solution: We implement cloud-native microservices on AKS with clear domain boundaries enabling independent team velocity. Infrastructure-as-Code with Terraform/Bicep allows developers to self-provision environments in minutes. Automated CI/CD pipelines handle build, test, security scanning, and deployment with zero-touch production releases. Comprehensive observability (logs, metrics, traces) with Application Insights and Grafana provides real-time system health visibility. Shift-left security with automated scanning, policy-as-code, and compliance gates in CI/CD.
technicalView.approach: Phase 1 (Weeks 1-4): Architecture assessment, target state design, pilot service selection, team topology design. Phase 2 (Weeks 5-10): Platform foundation - AKS cluster, CI/CD pipelines, observability, security baselines, developer portal. Phase 3 (Weeks 11-16): First microservice migration - extract, refactor, deploy, validate. Ongoing: Incremental migration of remaining services, continuous optimization, team capability building through pair programming.

technicalView.problem: Your legacy infrastructure consists of 200-500 servers in aging data centers with hardware nearing end-of-life. Applications are tightly coupled with undocumented dependencies making change risky. Database licenses cost ‚Çπ8-15 Cr annually with no elasticity. Manual scaling cannot handle peak traffic causing customer impact. Disaster recovery is complex and untested. Security patching requires application downtime. No automated deployment capability limits release frequency to quarterly at best.
technicalView.solution: We execute phased migration to Azure using automated discovery tools to map dependencies and create migration waves. Low-risk applications rehost to Azure VMs with immediate cost savings. Business-critical applications replatform to PaaS services (App Service, SQL Database, AKS) for improved resilience and lower operational overhead. Strategic applications refactor to cloud-native microservices for maximum agility. Azure Site Recovery provides automated disaster recovery. Hybrid architecture with Azure Arc enables consistent management and gradual migration.
technicalView.approach: Phase 1 (Weeks 1-4): Discovery using Azure Migrate, dependency mapping, application assessment, wave planning, TCO analysis. Phase 2 (Weeks 5-8): Landing zone setup - networking, security, governance, monitoring, cost management. Phase 3 (Weeks 9-20): Wave execution - typically 3-4 waves, each lasting 3-4 weeks, migrating 50-80 servers per wave. Phase 4 (Ongoing): Optimization - rightsizing, reserved instances, auto-scaling, modernization of selected applications.

leadershipView.problem: Your legacy infrastructure costs ‚Çπ50-80 Cr annually with 60-70% spent on maintenance rather than innovation. Data center contracts expiring in 12-18 months create urgent migration pressure. Hardware end-of-life risks unplanned outages and compliance violations. Current architecture cannot support business growth - adding capacity takes 3-6 months. Technical talent shortage for legacy technologies (mainframe, old Java, Oracle) increases risk. Security vulnerabilities in old systems expose organization to breach risk and regulatory penalties.
leadershipView.solution: We reduce infrastructure costs by 40-50% (‚Çπ20-40 Cr annual savings) through Azure's elastic scaling, reserved instances, and elimination of data center overhead. Migration to modern platforms improves system availability from 99.5% to 99.95%, reducing costly downtime. Elastic infrastructure supports business growth without upfront capital investment. Modern security controls (identity, encryption, threat protection) reduce breach risk by 70-80%. Access to global cloud talent pool solves staffing challenges.
leadershipView.approach: Phased 12-18 month program migrates entire portfolio with zero business disruption. Investment: ‚Çπ8-15 Cr for complete migration of 200-500 server estate. ROI achieved in 18-24 months through infrastructure cost savings, reduced downtime, avoided data center renewal costs. Quick wins in first 3 months: non-critical applications migrated showing immediate 30-40% cost reduction, building confidence for business-critical migration.
